alert.note: Alert for Mellette; Todd; Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued November 06 at 1:44AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .DISCUSSION...It will be partly cloudy this afternoon with high temperatures ranging from around 40 in northwest South Dakota to around 50 in south central South Dakota. Minimum relative humidity will range from 20 to 35 percent; lowest across southwest and south central South Dakota. Gusty west-northwest winds will continue through the day with gusts over 40 mph from northwest to south central South Dakota. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The grassland fire danger index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. The outlook for Monday afternoon, The grassland fire danger index will reach the very high category to extreme category.
